[[Théodred]] |previous=[[The Burnings of the Westfold]] |next=[[The Banishment of Éomer]] }} '''Massacre at the Fords of Isen''' is the seventh scene of [[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers'' (extended edition)]]. This scene was not featured in the theatrical release of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]''. ==Synopsis== The [[Riders of Rohan]] come upon the bodies of men of Rohan and horses at the [[Fords of Isen]]. Éomer instructs them to search for [[Théodred]], the son of King [[Théoden]]. He recognises the [[White Hand]] of [[Saruman]] painted on the armour of the orcs. They find Théodred badly wounded, but alive, and bring him to [[Edoras]]. ==Differences== It is told in [[Unfinished Tales]] that Théodred was found near the brink of death by [[Elfhelm]] and [[Grimbold]] rather than Éomer as happens in this scene. However, Théodred died at the Fords of Isen after asking the two men to "Keep the Fords until Éomer comes".{{UT|Isen}} {{references}} [[Category:The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers scenes|07]]
